Description: Scarab in glazed composition, possibly mould-made; underside decorated with four hieroglyphic signs arranged vertically (obelisk for Amun, waset sign, hes-vase and netjer sign).
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Petrie (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVII, no. 107). The scarab is much larger than any of the usual scarabs of the Sacrab Factory. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVII, no. 107)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.138) (phase 3)
